comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: I wonder is she is related to Fr. Dennis Blaney, a wonderful priest who runs Sharing Meadows in Indiana.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
8623220@N02
comment._content:
Richard Arthur Norton (1958-): Thanks for the additional information, including the passport scan! This is Isabella Blaney, or Mrs. Charles D. Blaney, and she was active in the women's suffrage movement of the early 20th century.  

We'll update the source data and then reload the description to Flickr.

comment.author: 25441481@N07
comment._content: The lace on Mts. Blaney's dress is a very fine example of machine made chemical lace.  This method of making machine lace is more of an embroidery where cotton thread was embroidered on a different fiber that could be burnt out chemically after the embroidery was fininshed, leaving the lace like fabric.
